page.title: 06Daresbury Church
page.content: In 1159 Henry II was proir of Norton, he built the church at Daresbury. The chuch was built of wood and it was filled with plaster so it was known as the white church of Cheshire. Charles Dodgson was born on the 27th January 1832 at the Old Parsonage in Newton- by-Daresbury. Father Reverand Charles Dodgson was vicar of Daresbury 1827-1843. They built a window in memory of Lewis Carroll. It was built and designed by Geoffry Webb and it was dedicated by the Bishop Warrington on June 30th 1934. The main subject of it is the Adoration of the Babe of Bethlehem. At the bottom of the window are characters from his famous stories.The vicar at present is the Rev. Stanley Beckett who comes every Wednesday to read us stories from the bible. We go to church for various festivals.
